1.text: I exhort then, first of all, that supplications, prayers, intercessions and thanksgivings be offered on behalf of all men;

2.text: including kings and all who are in high station, in order that we may live peaceful and tranquil lives with all godliness and gravity.

3.text: This is right, and is pleasing in the sight of God our Saviour,

4.text: who is willing for all mankind to be saved and come to a full knowledge of the truth.

5.text: For there is but one God and but one Mediator between God and men—Christ Jesus, Himself man;

6.text: who gave Himself as the redemption price for all—a fact testified to at its own appointed time,

7.text: and of which I have been appointed a herald and an Apostle (I am speaking the truth: it is not a fiction)

8.text: So then I would have the men everywhere pray, lifting to God holy hands which are unstained with anger or strife;

9.text: and I would have the women dress becomingly, with modesty and self-control, not with plaited hair or gold or pearls or costly clothes,

10.text: but—as befits women making a claim to godliness—with the ornament of good works.

11.text: A woman should quietly learn from others with entire submissiveness.

12.text: I do not permit a woman to teach, nor have authority over a man, but she must remain silent.

13.text: For Adam was formed first, and then Eve;

14.text: and Adam was not deceived, but his wife was thoroughly deceived, and so became involved in transgression.

15.text: Yet a woman will be brought safely through childbirth if she and her husband continue to live in faith and love and growing holiness, with habitual self-restraint.
